children.name: Airport
children.description: Signage located throughout terminals in arrival and departure areas, ticketing areas, baggage claim, gate-hold rooms, concourses, retail shops, and VIP lounges.

children.name: Arrival Hall
children.description: Locations for meeting passengers arriving on flights

children.name: Baggage Claim
children.description: Locations to retrieve baggage not carried during a flight

children.name: Departures Hall
children.description: Location for dropping off passengers leaving on flights

children.name: Food Court
children.description: Location within an airport for food, typically casual

children.name: Gates
children.description: Location to wait for or embark or disembark from a specific plane

children.name: Lounges
children.description: (typically private) places to wait for flights, separate from public spaces

children.name: Shopping Area
children.description: Retail areas contained within facilities primarily used for servicing flights

children.name: Bar
children.description: Location within an airport that serves alcoholic beverages.

children.name: Bus
children.description: Displays located on or in city or intercity buses.

children.name: Bus Interior
children.description: Displays located within the interior of city or intercity buses.

children.name: Terminal
children.description: Advertising at facilities for embarking or disembarking from a bus.

children.name: Bus (Outside)
children.description: Displays located on the exterior of city or intercity buses.

children.name: Taxi & Rideshare TV
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside taxis and rideshare vehicles visible to passengers in the back seat.

children.name: Taxi & Rideshare Top
children.description: (DEPRECATED) - See Outdoor Category (ID - 307) Advertising displays placed on top of taxi and rideshare vehicles visible to nearby pedestrian and drivers.

children.name: Subway
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside subway trains or inside stations or on subway platforms.

children.name: Subway Train Interior
children.description: Advertising displays placed on the interior of subway trains

children.name: Subway Platform
children.description: Areas to wait for, board, or unboard a subway

children.name: Subway Station
children.description: Displays placed within the concourse areas of a station

children.name: Subway Train Exterior
children.description: Advertising displays placed on the exterior of subway trains

children.name: Train
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside commuter or long distance trains, stations or on platforms.

children.name: Train Interior
children.description: Displays placed in the interior of a railroad or commuter style train

children.name: Platform
children.description: Areas to wait for, board, or unboard a train

children.name: Train Exterior
children.description: Displays placed on the exterior of a railroad or commuter style train

children.name: Station
children.description: Displays placed within the concourse or exterior areas of a commuter style train station.

children.name: Ferry
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside a passenger water transport.

children.name: Ferry Interior
children.description: Displays located within the interior of city or intercity ferries

children.name: Ferry Exterior
children.description: Displays located on the exterior of city or intercity ferries

children.name: Ferry Terminal
children.description: Advertising at facilities for embarking or disembarking from a ferry or boat

children.name: Tram
children.description: Displays placed on the interior, exterior, or at the stations of urban light rail trams or streetcars.

children.name: Tram Interior
children.description: Displays located within the interior of tram or street cars

children.name: Tram Exterior
children.description: Displays located on the exterior of tram or street cars

children.name: Tram Station
children.description: Advertising at facilities for embarking or disembarking from a tram or streetcar

children.name: Highway Rest Area
children.description: A rest area or service stop designed for drivers, often found along highways or motorways. These areas provide facilities like fuel stations, restaurants and restrooms.

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Displays located outside of any service buildings within the confines of a rest area

children.name: Concourse
children.description: Displays located with the pedestrian concourse of a rest area, typically interior atrium or hallway type areas

children.name: Food Court
children.description: A Common area with multiple food vendors and common tables.

children.name: Restroom
children.description: Displays within the restrooms of a highway rest area

children.name: Fueling Station
children.description: An establishment beside a road selling fuel for motor vehicles.

children.name: Fuel Dispenser
children.description: A (typically self-service) device for dispensing fuel to vehicles.

children.name: Shop
children.description: A store attached to a location who's primary audience is people fueling vehicles

children.name: Convenience Store
children.description: A store with extended opening hours and in a convenient location, stocking a limited range of household goods and groceries.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Grocery
children.description: A retail shop that primarily sells food, either fresh or preserved.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Liquor Store
children.description: A retail shop that predominantly sells prepackaged alcoholic beverages, typically in bottles, intended to be consumed off the store’s premises.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Mall
children.description: A large building or series of connected buildings containing a variety of retail stores and typically also restaurants.

children.name: Concourse
children.description: A large open area (including hallways and escalators)

children.name: Food Court
children.description: A Common area with multiple food vendors and common tables.

children.name: Spectacular
children.description: Large and impactful screen(s) at a prime location. It often utilizes special embellishments.

children.name: Cannabis Dispensary
children.description: A store that sells and dispenses cannabis and CBD products.

children.name: Pharmacy
children.description: A store where medicinal drugs are dispensed and sold.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Parking Garage
children.description: A building in which people usually pay to park their cars, trucks and other vehicles.

children.name: Furniture
children.description: An establishment that sells furniture.

children.name: Apparel
children.description: An establishment that sells clothing and accessories.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Automotive
children.description: An establishment where a person engages in the Business of selling, offering for sale, or providing servicing or maintenance of a motor vehicle.

children.name: Laundromat
children.description: An establishment with coin-operated washing machines and dryers for public use.

children.name: Vape Shop
children.description: An establishment specializing in the selling of vaping products.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Mass Merchandising
children.description: An establishment with a wide range of goods where customers can purchase products, sometimes in bulk.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Consumer Electronic
children.description: An establishment that sells electronic devices intended for personal or household use, such as appliances, home entertainment systems, and communication devices. These stores may also offer repair services and occasionally sell used goods.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Retail Other
children.description: A retail business not currently defined by the taxonomy.

children.name: Sporting Good
children.description: An establishment that specializes in selling new sporting equipment, apparel, and related accessories.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Pet Store
children.description: An establishment that sells domestic animals and supplies related to their care, like food, toys, and accessories.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Office Supply
children.description: An establishment that sells domestic animals and supplies related to their care, like food, toys, and accessories.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Home Renovation
children.description: An establishment that sells a wide range of products for home improvement, repair, and decoration. A home renovation store, also known as a home improvement center or home center.

children.name: Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Exterior
children.description: Area on or near the outside of the building

children.name: Billboard
children.description: Located primarily on major roads, they attract high-density consumer exposure (mostly to vehicular traffic, but often to pedestrians).

children.name: Roadside  (Deprecated)
children.description: Primarily vehicular environments

children.name: Highway  (Deprecated)
children.description: High-speed vehicular environments, typically with controlled entrance/exit (e.g. "exits" or "interchanges")

children.name: Spectacular (Deprecated)
children.description: (DEPRECATE - see child category 304) A bulletin that is usually larger than 14’ x 48’ and is positioned at a prime location in a market. A spectacular often utilizes special embellishments.

children.name: Urban Panel
children.description: Digital screens in urban environments, typically providing a public amenity. Typically facing perpedicular to pedestrians, and in some cases vehicular traffic.

children.name: Bus Shelter
children.description: Enclosures where individuals may wait for buses in an urban environment. Signage may be attached to the interior or exterior of the enclosure.

children.name: Spectacular
children.description: A bulletin that is usually larger than 14’ x 48’ and is positioned at a prime location in a market. A spectacular often utilizes special embellishments.

children.name: Window Panel
children.description: An exterior facing digital display located either in front of or directly behind the window of a building. Typically facing parallel to pedestrians, and in some cases vehicular traffic.

children.name: Moving Billboard
children.description: A digital display appended to or built into the sides and/or back of a vehicle or boat visible to nearby pedestrians and drivers.

children.name: Car Top
children.description: Advertising displays placed on top of taxi and rideshare vehicles visible to nearby pedestrian and drivers.

children.name: Aerial
children.description: Advertising displays that are flown in the sky.

children.name: Aerial Banner
children.description: Advertising display that is carried or pulled behind a flying vehicle (i.e.; helicopter or airplane)

children.name: Aerial Drone
children.description: Drone light shows that are used to showcase/represent brands and advertising placements

children.name: EV Charging Station
children.description: A digital display associated with a piece of infrastructure that allows electric vehicles to recharge their batteries.

children.name: Gym
children.description: A club, building, or large room, usually containing special equipment, where people go to do physical exercise and get fit.

children.name: Lobby
children.description: Area for waiting or meeting guests

children.name: Fitness Equipment
children.description: Area primarily for exercise or the usage of fitness equipment

children.name: Salon
children.description: An establishment where a hairdresser, beautician, or couturier conducts business.

children.name: Unisex Salon
children.description: Salon catering to clients of any sex

children.name: Men's Salon
children.description: Salon primarily catering towards men

children.name: Women's Salon
children.description: Salon primarily catering towards women

children.name: Nail
children.description: Salon primarily catering towards men

children.name: Tanning
children.description: Salon primarily catering towards women

children.name: Spa
children.description: A commercial establishment offering health and beauty treatment through such means as steam baths, exercise equipment, and massage.

children.name: Tattoo
children.description: An establishment in which tattooing is carried out professionally.

children.name: Doctor’s Office
children.description: Non-hospital facility run by a physician - for treatment of people.

children.name: Veterinary Office
children.description: Non-hopsital facility run by a veterinarian - for treatment of animals.

children.name: Dentist Office
children.description: A place where dental professionals practice dentistry and offer oral health care to patients.

children.name: Hospital
children.description: An institution providing medical and surgical treatment and nursing care for sick or injured people.

children.name: Urgent Care
children.description: A medical facility or clinic that provides prompt treatment for illnesses and injuries that aren't life-threatening.

children.name: Physiotherapy
children.description: A healthcare facility who focuses on restoring movement and function after injury, illness, or disability.

children.name: School
children.description: An educational institution designed to provide learning spaces and learning environments for the teaching of students between K - 12 under the direction of teachers.

children.name: College  and University
children.description: An education institution designed for instruction, examination, or both, of students  in many branches of advanced learning, conferring degrees in various faculties, and often embodying colleges and similar institutions.

children.name: Residence
children.description: Places where faculty or students live

children.name: Common Area
children.description: Shared spaces for study, dining, or leisure activities

children.name: Athletic Facility
children.description: Facillities or stadiums for sporting competition

children.name: Dining
children.description: On campus facility where food is served for students, staff and visitors

children.name: Office Building
children.description: An office building, also known as an office block or business center is a form of commercial building which contains spaces mainly designed to be used for offices. Advertising displays may be in building lobbies, common areas, or in elevators.

children.name: Elevator
children.description: Enclosed, Vertical conveyance for people and goods

children.name: Lobby
children.description: Common space for tenants to meet and greet visitors and guests, typically near entrances

children.name: Gym
children.description: Area within an office building that usually contains special equipment, where people go to do physical exercise and get fit.

children.name: Break Room
children.description: A designated area in a workplace where employees can take breaks, relax, eat, and socialize. It serves as a space away from the main work area, offering a place for employees to de-stress, recharge, and interact with colleagues.

children.name: Warehouse
children.description: A large building where raw materials or manufactured goods may be stored before their export or distribution for sale.

children.name: Recreational Location
children.description: Location where recreational and/or leisure activities take place.

children.name: Theme Park
children.description: An amusement park with a unifying setting or idea.

children.name: Museums and Gallery
children.description: A building in which objects of historical, scientific, artistic, or cultural interest are stored and exhibited. e.g. "the Museum of Modern Art"

children.name: Concert Venue
children.description: Any location used for a concert or musical performance

children.name: Bowling Alley
children.description: A location where patrons can take part in bowling activities

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of a recreational facility, a location where recreational and/or leisure activities take place.

children.name: Movie Theater
children.description: Location for displaying long-format content on large screens.

children.name: Lobby
children.description: A corridor or hall connected with a larger room or series of rooms and used as a passageway or waiting room: such as a large hall serving as a foyer (as of a hotel or theater)

children.name: Food Court
children.description: An area within a building (such as a shopping mall) set apart for food concessions.

children.name: On Screen
children.description: An area within a theater where films are displayed on large screens, typically within an auditorium

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of a movie theater, a location for displaying long-format content on large screens

children.name: Sports Entertainment
children.description: A venue that individuals or groups can play an active sport or activity.

children.name: Sport Arena
children.description: A central area used for sports or other forms of entertainment and surrounded by seats for spectators.

children.name: Club House
children.description: Locker rooms used by an athletic team

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of a venue that individuals or groups can play an active sport or activity.

children.name: Bar
children.description: A retail business that serves alcoholic beverages.

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restoom of a retail business that serves alcoholic beverages.

children.name: Casual Dining
children.description: A restaurant that serves moderately priced food in a casual atmosphere.

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of a restaurant that serves moderately priced food in a casual atmosphere.

children.name: QSR
children.description: A fast food restaurant, also known as a quick service restaurant within the industry, is a specific type of restaurant that serves fast-food cuisine and has minimal table service.

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of a fast food restaurant, also known as a quick service restaurant within the industry, is a specific type of restaurant that serves fast-food cuisine and has minimal table service.

children.name: Hotel
children.description: An establishment providing accommodations, means, and other services for travelers and tourists.

children.name: Lobby
children.description: Commonly accessible shared spaces for guests at a hotel

children.name: Elevator
children.description: Commonly accessible, enclosed spaces used to move between floors.

children.name: Room
children.description: Locations occupied and restricted to a single guest

children.name: Bar
children.description: An area within a hotel that serves alcoholic beverages

children.name: Gym
children.description: Area within a hotel that usually contains special equipment, where people go to do physical exercise and get fit.

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of an establishment providing accommodations, means, and other services for travelers and tourists.

children.name: Golf Cart
children.description: A small motorized vehicle for golfers and their equipment.

children.name: Night Club
children.description: An establishment for nighttime entertainment, typically serving drinks and offering music, dancing, etc.

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of an establishment for nighttime entertainment, typically serving drinks and offering music, dancing, etc.

children.name: High-End Dining
children.description: (Deprecate) A restaurant that serves expensive food. Often in a more formal atmosphere, and accepting or requiring reservations

children.name: Casinos
children.description: A public room or building where gambling games are played.

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of a public room or building where gambling games are played.

children.name: Convention Center
children.description: A large building or complex of buildings designed to host conventions, trade shows, exhibitions, and other large-scale events

children.name: Restroom
children.description: The restroom of a large building or complex of buildings designed to host conventions, trade shows, exhibitions, and other large-scale events

children.name: DMV
children.description: An office building, also known as an office block or business center is a form of commercial building which contains spaces mainly designed to be used for offices. Advertising displays may be in building lobbies, common areas, or in elevators.

children.name: Military Base
children.description: A facility that houses and facilitates training for military personnel and operations.

children.name: Post Office
children.description: A facility that handles the receipt, delivery, and processing of mail, packages, or other postal services.

children.name: First Responder Facility
children.description: A facility that houses and facilitates training and/or living quarters for Police, Fire, EMS and other first responders

children.name: Bank
children.description: A bank is a financial institution licensed to store or invest accountholders money

children.name: Apartment Building  and Condominium
children.description: A building that contains different residential units

children.name: Lobby
children.description: A corridor or hall connected with a larger room or series of rooms and used as a passageway or waiting room: such as a large hall serving as a foyer (as of a hotel or theater)

children.name: Elevator
children.description: Enclosed, Vertical conveyance for people and goods

children.name: Gym
children.description: Area within a residential building that usually contains special equipment, where people go to do physical exercise and get fit.
